intro: Derris nyanzae, commonly known as the East African spurge, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with simple, alternate leaves. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in complex inflorescences called cyathia. Derris nyanzae is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and grasslands.
